reference: Volume Four, Issue Forty-Four, File 18 of 27
title: Searching the Dialog Information Service
historical_context: This article reflects the transition from an industrial to an information age, highlighting the importance of information access in various fields, including law and academia.
target_audience: Hackers, information brokers, researchers, and security professionals.
short_summary: This article provides a comprehensive guide on using the Dialog Information Service, detailing access methods, search strategies, and the significance of information in the digital age. It emphasizes the need for effective search techniques to navigate vast databases efficiently.
summary: Capone elaborates on the search strategies within Dialog, distinguishing between contrived and free text searching. He explains the significance of developing a search strategy that minimizes costs and maximizes efficiency, advocating for the use of thesauri and synonym dictionaries to enhance search results. The article also details the command structure of Dialog, including how to utilize various commands for effective searching and retrieving information. Capone concludes by reflecting on his journey from hacking to legal information retrieval, underscoring the evolving hacker ethic and the potential for legal 'hacking' as a profession. This article serves as a valuable resource for anyone looking to navigate the complexities of information databases in the digital age.
